item.title: How many major political parties can coexist in Canada?
item.description: Recently, for an assignment, I had to answer the following question: “Duverger’s Law contends that Single Member Plurality systems produce two party systems dominated by a competition for centrist voters. What are the assumptions behind this argument? How can we explain the main exceptions to this law in the Canadian context?” This is a timely issue. The federal election is coming up at the end of this year, and between 3 and 5 (6 in Quebec?

item.title: About
item.description: Welcome! I’m Justin Savoie, a student of political science, programmer, data scientist and somewhat dilettante philosophy enthusiast. This will at some point become my personal website. Right now, it’s simply a place where I can share thoughts. The theme was forked from @jrutheiser/hugo-lithium-theme and modified by Yihui Xie.
